website_summaries.verdict: This grinder has the capacity to grind enough beans for 2 pots of coffee, but the markings inside the bowl make it practical for smaller portions, too.
pros: Grinds up to 3.2 ounces of beans at a time
Grinds enough for up to 18 cups
Measurement markings inside bowl make it easy to grind the exact quantity of beans you need
Removable stainless steel bowl is dishwasher-safe
cons: The design allows grounds to easily fall out onto your counter when removing the lid

customer_reviews.title: If you jerry rig it’ll work as expected
customer_reviews.text: As other customers posted, this coffee grinder will cause coffee dust to fall outside the container and it will be messy. However, all other coffee grinders I researched will have similar problem or other problems and/or these coffee grinders will be more expensive. If you put a rubber band around the internal rounded part of UV lid then the coffee spill will stop. I used a rubber band with a smaller circumference and a wider band that came in my produce. Considering the price of this grinder and the easy solution I applied, I decided to keep as the price offsets the faulty design. But it is a pity that Cuisinart allow this happens...
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: It makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: The malfunction with this product is as you grind the coffee it rises above the lip of the container and makes a mess! It doesn’t seal. So as you take the lid off it spills all over the counter! It grinds the coffee perfect so I give it a one star! It is frustrating because I have had this product in the past and had no issues so that is why I purchased it again! So I bought it and had to return it and now another return this is frustrating having good coffee is important and not having it become even more complicated is very important! So please fix this issue! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Montenegro

customer_reviews.title: Machine stopped working less than one year into warranty. ...
customer_reviews.text: Machine stopped working less than one year into warranty. I paid $18.00 to return defective unit, as instructed by Cuisinart, then was charged $10.81 for postage/tax on new unit. The new unit's warranty is only the remaining time (6 months) on my old unit's warranty. This brings my total investment to $26.99 (original Amazon cost) +$18.00 postage to mail defective unit + $10.81 to pay for postage of new unit= $55.00. I will not be buying Cuisinart products again- Very dissatisfied customer, Rosemary Ludway
customer_reviews.author: rosemary ludway

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Two-Pot Size Coffee/Spice Grinder with Removable Grinding Bowl
customer_reviews.text: This is the second version of this particular coffee grinder - the first one lasted for about twelve years of steady service, and we'd be still using it if the cats hadn't knocked the top off the sideboard for the umpteenth time, and broken the Grind Button Assembly built into it. Not much to say other than it does the job as advertised, has a generous 3 oz. grinding bowl (enough for two pots of coffee), and because the bowl's removable you can use it for spices, then wash it thoroughly before you use it again for coffee. Absolutely worth the $25 I paid for it then, and now.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Liebe

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra few bucks!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these and bought 2 more as gifts for my parents and in lawa. They are excellent products. Two key advantages over other grinders. 1. The grinding tub detaches so you can leave the base plugged in and just dump the tub into your coffeemaker. Just a lot easier and neater. 2. You can clean the tub in the dishwasher. So you can grind nuts or spices in it then clean thoroughly vs ruining your next few batches of coffee. Also when it gets gunky with coffee grounds it's a snap to clean. Re the complaints about grounds spilling just give the top a few taps after grinding and the grounds will settle down.
customer_reviews.author: WSK

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had saved the box
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this unit to replace the same one that had finally died after eight years. Not only is the grinding cup smaller than the previous version, the fit between the lip of the cup and the cover is poor resulting in grounds going all over the inside of the unit. Will likely be donating this to Goodwill and purchasing something different.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Schulz

customer_reviews.title: First Use, But...
customer_reviews.text: It's not all I can see. The design is pretty. I liked it. I'm so disappointed. It is used for the first time after purchasing it, but it cannot operate the on/off button as it suddenly overflows with coffee. Just turning around by itself. On/off Buttons are useless. Just stop when plug out. plug it in and grinder'll turn around by itself. On/off button useless Besides, there's a bad smell of burning rubber. It's so bad. The room is mess of coffee bean. I’m sososososososo angry.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Park

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't acheive very fine coffee grings
customer_reviews.text: I've always ground my coffee beans fresh. My old grinder - which produced a very fine grind for use in a high pressure espresso machine was reaching end-of-life. Everything about this model was what I wanted except. It is powerful, yet not to noise, well built, easy to clean. But no matter how long I ground the beans it could not come close to what my old grinder produced. It might be that the spinning blade sits up high over the grings so a lot of the coffee seems to get stuck on the bottom. Don't know the reason but if you are looking for grinding beans for French Press or drip this will do teh job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aceti

customer_reviews.title: THIS GRINDER IS LOUD AND VIBRATES!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a replacement for the same model grinder (that Cuisinart changed a bit) that broke after 15 years of service. The other worked great until the button failed. This grinder works the same as the old except for one thing, IT IS LOUD!!!!!! The blades are out of balance or loose or something like that. The old one was smoother and much quieter. This one vibrates something fierce, and, did I mention how LOUD it is. Very disappointed. Hey Cuisinart, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.
customer_reviews.author: No Mercy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. A little messy though. This design should be improved.
customer_reviews.text: 1. It grinds well but takes a bit to get a fine grind. 2. Also the cover lets a bit of grinds fall to the base near the motor area. This is because the grinding cover(top part) does not seal so tightly. Every time it is used it is necessary to put the machine upside down if you want to clean the grinds that fall outside of the grinding chamber. 3. The included airtight freshness cap used to preserve excess ground coffee makes the grinding cover unable to fit on top. This means it does not store so well as it is now loose on top and might fall and crack if moved. (hypothetically)
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Several years old and  still going
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these. The first one lasted around 10 years, I believe, and now this new one is several years old and going strong. For being a blade grinder, it does very well on coffee. It's not as good as a single-stage adjustable grinder, but then it doesn't cost nearly as much. My only complaint is that it did not come with the larger cup as advertised. For me, that wasn't a big deal, since I still had the cup and cover from my previous one. This new one came with a storage lid, which either my last one did not or it was lost in a move long ago, so that was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: NowhereRx7

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of the grinder and the ease of use. However, I noticed coffee flew out from under the grinder cup every time I used it. I found out the gasket was loose and it was causing coffee to leak out into the bottom of the grinder. After using the product a few time the grinder blade came off. I used this product 5 times total when this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this grinder for an wanting a convenient coffee grinder. It is compact, stylish and easy to clean. It is easy to use as measurements are marked on the inside of the cup. It only takes a few seconds to grind enough coffee beans to make 16 cups of coffee. (I assume they mean 6 ounce cups.) The grinding cup is removable, dishwasher safe and comes with a lid to store your coffee. I enjoyed being able to grind coffee and not wake up the family.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee grinder. It was first recommended to me by our son who had one. Compact & easy to use. I have them at three different houses/condos and honestly can't imagine getting along without it. You control the grind level by how long you hold the button down, so I can grind for my regular coffee maker or for a cappuccino maker... whatever. Price is right, storage is easy, use & clean up are simple. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Justa Girl

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: We had a similar Cuisinart grinder of an earlier year—maybe 10 years earlier. It was faithful til it died a month ago. We replaced it with this more modern version. Only change is that the grinding cup is a little smaller. The motor body remains the same. We fully expect this one to last a decade too. Cuisinart costs more, but it is well designed and built to last. I like products that don’t break prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The length of grind makes some parts grind too finely while other parts never grind at all.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grinder to replace a similarly-sized grinder that has aged poorly. However, this grinder does not grind as well as my old grinder. It takes much longer to grind something and the length of grind makes some parts grind too finely while other parts never grind at all. If I had more energy and time, I'd return this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bellew

customer_reviews.title: RELIABLE RELIABLE & AFFORDABLE
customer_reviews.text: Rather than purchase a spice grinder, I decided to replace my 20+ year old coffee grinder with a new one ... yes, the exact same model. The grinding bowl is removable, making it much easier to move the grounds to the coffee maker AND to keep the grinder bowl clean. I am sure the new grinder will be just as reliable and easy to use as the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Guiseclowes

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to keep clean.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return because the grounds get spit up into the top and in crevices that are too hard to reach. It’s as if the lid does not come down far enough into grinding cup. When I’d open, coffee grounds would get disbursed onto counter. Just too messy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay.
customer_reviews.text: I like the grind, and it does so effortlessly. I hate the mess that it makes. If you fill it even 2/3 full, ground end up flying out of the top of the mill cup and onto the platform around the mill cup. So there's always a dusty mess...on the plastic base surrounding the mill cup, on your counter, everywhere. While it grinds nicely, there is just no way to use this product without making a mess. That's just a stupid design. There was no way for anyone to somehow NOT notice this problem when testing the product, assuming that they did.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart quality has gone down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third of this model I have owned. The first lasted more than ten years. The second lasted about a year until the grinder stem broke. It was also messy with grounds everywhere. I read a similar review from last year and hoped the problems had been resolved. I like the large removable cup so I’ll use this one until it dies. I have low expectations for it taking long. I will be looking for a non-Cuisinart model and coffee maker, since the grinder matched my maker. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D.

customer_reviews.title: All ground up and nowhere to go!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in November and I don’t use it constantly as I alternate buying beans versus ground depending on the deals. I began to use it a lot during the Pandemic and low and behold it stopped working. A month or two solid usage of once a week maybe twice and it dies?!!! Based on some of the other reviews with similar problems I won’t be attempting to return this unit. But I also won’t be purchasing anything coffee related with Cuisinart in the future!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: poor design leaves a messy result.. but there’s a workaround
customer_reviews.text: If you try to use the regular top, This grinder throws grounds out the top edges of the bowl and around the edge of the machine every time.. making a huge mess. I remedy this by not using the plastic top, but the rubber bowl lid and activating the grind button with a wine opener.... which you’ll need handy once you clean up the coffee ground mess when trying to use this machine per the instructions
customer_reviews.author: Lorna C. Briddick

customer_reviews.title: I liked my first one so much, I bought a replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one of the same I had for the past 5 years. Simple way to fresh grind my coffee every morning. I blend several beans to make a custom blend of coffee, so a reliable grinder is key. Inexpensive way to ensure I have a great cup of coffee for me and my wife every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Jack

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar model by this company for a number of years. It was perfect but the motor finally died. I didn't even look at other brands before buying this. It is not engineered well and shoots coffee everywhere, even under the grinder cup. I saw where another customer had place a rubber band inside to keep the coffee in. I did that and it now works better but still not as well as the original. What a disappointment. I learned that I should still research before buying, even when I think I know the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder and easy to detach and clean the steel; only one complaint!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder, very easy to use and clean, and I specifically ordered this one because of the removable steel bowl, which is also dishwasher safe and super convenient. However, my only complaint is with the little spillage that is inevitable when grinding the coffee beans, since there is a relatively big gap on the bottom of the steel bowl right underneath the blades, and coffee grounds tend to spill out of that gap! This is something that could've very easily been avoidable by Cuisinart! Definitely recommend the seller and the grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Farbod

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this grinder for at least 5 years and it's held up great. Works perfect for my French press or stovetop espresso maker, very easy to use. I got one for my FIL and best friend more recently, they both are happy with it. My FIL has used it to blend spices and said it worked well for that too.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this after having the same or a similar one for about 9 years. The new design always seems to spill coffee grinds over the cup which then falls on the counter. Perhaps I’m overfilling it’s, but I’m using the same amount of coffee that worked in the last and a seal is a seal!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Casper, RD @NourishedBite

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, messy.
customer_reviews.text: Grinds great. But, the grinds come out of the bowl and all around the outside under the lid. So there’s constantly grinds everywhere. Don’t know how long I will keep this one, as I have to basically unplug it every day or every other day to dump grinds out so my counter doesn’t get full of them. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Janissa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of now grinding my own coffee to keep freshness. This grinds super well, is super quick, and I love how the cup comes out to easily dump it into my coffee maker, instead of clumsily trying to dump upside down the whole unit like the cheaper model my roommate had.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: Not what as expected from cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: Good design. But coffee leaks, and the blade base moves up and down and that also let the coffee escape after you remove the bowl. I would look for another product.
customer_reviews.author: Iyad K.

customer_reviews.title: Bowl and grinder shaft lock independently
customer_reviews.text: There are two "locks" for securing the bowl in the grinder, one for the bowl itself and the other for the grinder shaft. The two locks are independent of each other so you can release the bowl but you cannot remove it because the grinder shaft is still locked. You can stick something down into the ground coffee and turn the grinder shaft manually while you search for the position that will unlock it, but that sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Stompinetti

customer_reviews.title: Third one of these that I have purchased in 14 years
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one because this grinder works well and holds up for a long time. I did note that the motor is noticeably louder than the prior two units I have owned, but you only run it for maybe 30 seconds, so it's probably not much of an issue for most people.
customer_reviews.author: JCH

customer_reviews.title: Coffee gounds everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Coffee spins up the side of the canister between the cover and grinder bowl edge and pushes coffee past it. I lose the equivalent of a cup Of coffee worth of grinds a week. It’s messy AF.
customer_reviews.author: Renee R. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, easy to use and a very good grind. Not too bulky, what more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe

customer_reviews.title: grinds get all over the place
customer_reviews.text: this coffee grinder is terrible, it shoots the grounds all over the place. they fly out of the silver cup and end up all around the edges of the coffee grinder and then all over the counter. it also doesnt do a very good job at actually grinding the beans. i always end up with huge chunks towards the center, even when i run it for a long time. bad grinder
customer_reviews.author: Leshawndro

customer_reviews.title: Great brand....bad idea
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations based on appliance name brand. I was even fooled by "easy to use" sales video. Negatives: wimpy grinding button, mess of coffee grounds on and around machine when lid is lifted to check the grind, needed multiple times for each miniscule batch, unplugging grinder each time. So frustrating, I went back to using my Starbucks mini shake grinder. In conclusion, if not for the sharp blades, this small grinder is more toy than useful appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Wish could return it but I threw the box away before testing it. All the grounds leak out of the compartment everytime and it makes a terrible mess. This device is utterly useless for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: RamenIsGood

customer_reviews.title: dependable
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one thinking my original product had a bearing that had broken. That was not the case and a good cleaning was all it needed. I have had the originasl for 15 years with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel swan

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: I got this for grinding coffee. The exterior looks nice and sleek for the kitchen counter, but use it and you'll find coffee grounds spill over the side while grinding, onto the counter when you take off the lid. Soooo disappointing. There's no way to seal the top edge. Too late to return, so this one is going to the back of my cabinet for grinding spices on rare occasions. Really disappointed in the Cuisinart brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: As you see from the picture, the grinder cup doesn’t go all the way to the top of the lid. If your grinding more than 6 cups of coffee it goes everywhere. So annoying wishing I could return it after 2 months use. I just bought a more expensive one model # DBM-8.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Only Three Months of Use!
customer_reviews.text: We had a Cuisinart grinder for years and it worked perfectly until it finally quit after about 10 years of use. Since or experience was so positive, we purchased another in December. It did not work as easily as the pervious one--had to push down to engage the blade but we got used to the extra effort...until the blade does not engage at all now after just over three months of use. This is junk--never buying another Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.author: John Seeley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t grind consistently
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these grinders several years ago and still use it. Great coffee grinder but I bought another for my RV and the quality has gone down. I have to Run it twice as long and it doesn’t grind consistently. There will be whole beans left along with powder fine in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: DTB

customer_reviews.title: the best grinder i’ve ever ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grinder i’ve ever ever owned! It is fast and so easy to use. the fact that the bowl comes apart from the whole machine and has a lid to keep freshness is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Vezza

customer_reviews.title: Works but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to grind spice. It takes some time to grind the spices. Also debris spill over from the crumb while grinding. Sometimes I have a hard time removing the cup from the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Bipool

customer_reviews.title: DON'T EXPECT IT TO LAST MORE THAN A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I use this coffee grinder everyday. I have purchased one just about every year. They don't last long but work well while they work. I purchased the SquareTrade protection, they denied my claim staying they don't cover accidental damage even though I never entered the problem as "accidental damage." I think Square Trade Protection is a rip-off, and there's no way to contact them to resolve a dispute.
customer_reviews.author: J. Flisk

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, no mess grinder, for under $30.00 AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Stanton

customer_reviews.title: After a decade, I replaced it with the same model
customer_reviews.text: It grinds coffee, with reasonably consistent results. It is easy to wipe out, is reasonably quiet and meets my needs. I replaced a 2008 purchase with the same product. Complaints: Not great at containing coffee dust, top doesn't latch/secure to base, "measurements" only visible on one side of canister. I'm hard on kitchen products. this handled my uncaffeinated, bearish self for a decade until I finally broke it.
customer_reviews.author: Bear O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: grinds great but has a couple of issues
customer_reviews.text: Cover doesn't fit tight and unit spews grinds all over the kitchen counter and on the outside of the grinder unit. The base unit is not at all easy to clean. Top and grinder part easy to clean in dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: dukedom

customer_reviews.title: convenient enough to grind your daily
customer_reviews.text: It does do what it says it does but you can only do couple ounces at one time. Not very convenient when you buy a bag full of beans. But convenient enough to grind your daily
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Palma

customer_reviews.title: Messy Operation--Ground coffee spills over during operation
customer_reviews.text: When using this coffee grinder, the ground beans spill over the top of the stainless steel insert into the inclosed area. When I open the coffee grinder, ground beans spill unto the counter. This makes cleaning up in and around the coffee grinder extra work each day. I've tried to use less and more coffee to prevent the spill over, but nothing seems to work. I like about most everything else about this coffee grinder, but would NOT buy it again. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J L King

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This grinder spills coffee outside of the bin which I did not anticipate. Sent back due to the great mess it makes. I ensured to apply gentle pressure to the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder for $; will grind almost anything
customer_reviews.text: You can grind anything in this. I love it! I had my first one for years and a kid broke it. I cried! Then went to Amazon and immediately bought a new one. Didn't even look at other options, that's saying something.
customer_reviews.author: sexy woman

customer_reviews.title: Found this product not made well and not advertised correctly
customer_reviews.text: I have owned multiple Cuisinart Grinders. This is not made near as well as my previous purchases. It also indicated that it was an 18 cup grinder and it barely holds 12 cups. When the beans grind, it gets all over the sides. Now, there is the added bonus of the fact that after only a week of use, we can barely get the grinder cup out of the grinder. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: COFFEE BEAN GRINDER
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT NAME MADE ME DO THIS AM I SORRY YES BUT BECAUSE IT IS SMALL AND I HAVE A HARD TIME GETTING THE GRINDED BEANS OUT OF THE MACHINE I WON'T SEND IT BACK BECAUSE IT WAS MY FAULT.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Lee

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't grind the beans all the way.
customer_reviews.text: When it is done grinding it leaves a mess around the grinder. I had to put a filter around the cutter to stop the grounds from getting all over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Must be missing the right usage process
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected the job quality to be. Maybe next time.
customer_reviews.author: mary foreman

customer_reviews.title: Mess maker mess maker make me a mess!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line this ginger is horrible. It makes a fricking mess every time it is used as the grinds fly over the grinder bowl and Landon on the sides of the base lip and fall on counter. Dissatisfied as they make such great coffee makers
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tool in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool in the kitchen! I use it every morning to grind my beans and I love it! I was using a hand grinder and then decided to upgrade to this and haven't looked back since! I would definitely recommend this product, it gives a nice even grind and you can choose how coarse or fine you want it simply by how long you press on the button.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Weiss

customer_reviews.title: This product is not as represented
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an existing DCG-12BC that I had used for years. Much to my negative surprise, what i received, which had the same model number as the grinder that i was replacing, had a much smaller basket than the older version of the same model. I like coffee very strong, and the volume of beans that i use were more than would fit easily into the basket. In the older version, the same amount of beans still left about 20% of space. As a result i returned the grinder and bought a different one from a different merchant.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in MD

customer_reviews.title: Not a serious vendor. DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: I received an old, used, and dirty coffee grinder that wasn't even the same model as the one described, although the box looked clean and new. Huge disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: Guy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I got this grinder as a shower gift last October. It then broke 6 months later. I bought this replacement and it’s now broken AGAIN. The metal cup gets stuck to the machine. No amount of pulling, locking or unlocking makes any difference. This happened with the original and now the replacement too! Garbage! I will be researching a new grinder to replace this one...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Great for Drip or Espresso Grind
customer_reviews.text: Very underwhelmed by this grinder. I was not expecting much for the price however it's impossible to get a uniform grind. It would probably work well for french press users, but if you need a fine grind you'll be disappointed. Another downside would be that the cover doesn't seal and allows grinds to escape. It's just a little bit, but my beans are precious.
customer_reviews.author: hibelu

customer_reviews.title: I want my money back
customer_reviews.text: I used this less than eight times and it is stuck in the on position. I guess it is too late to return it . I have to unplug it to turn it off. And it runs without the cover on so this happened.
customer_reviews.author: E. Broch

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size grider bowl included with the grinder - grinder is unuseable
customer_reviews.text: The wrong grinding bowl was included with the unit. The bowl is an inch to an inch and a half too short for the unit. Coffee goes everywhere when beans are ground. My old grinder worked fine because it had the correct sized bowl so that the plastic lid came down inside the bowl and coffee did not go everywhere. The unit I ordered is useless as it is.
customer_reviews.author: christine parker

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our old one stopped working after 20 years, actually the cord frayed. Loved how well it worked and wouldn't get anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Use every morning.
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder. Quality. Also works for grinding dried mushrooms, peppercorns, etc. My second machine. First lasted 6-7 yrs. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: avi8tor

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy - Junk
customer_reviews.text: I received this coffee grinder on May 23rd, 2020 and on August 13th, 2020 it completely stopped working after using it only three times. Amazon rep told me "We accept the return of merchandise as long as it's returned in new condition within 30 days of receipt." DO NOT BUY THIS GRINDER, IT IS JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Very essential
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that v have since so many years.... Our old ones blade was damaged n so I din think of anything else ... Ordered the same.... Arrived fast.... I also use this for grinding coriander . Cumin seeds etc .. it's an all in all grinder
customer_reviews.author: Heera paul

customer_reviews.title: We keep buying them because we like so
customer_reviews.text: Last about 3 years. We keep buying them because we like so much
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as my old one of the same brand but it works. I wish it grinders more at a time though.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle cooney

customer_reviews.title: The grind is good for my Chemex brewer
customer_reviews.text: It's not a burr grinder, but it is quick, relatively quiet and does a decent job. Not as messy as my burr grinder. The grind is fairly consistent if you "time" yourself. I leave the button down about 30 seconds, then tap the side and give it about 15 more seconds. The grind is good for my Chemex brewer. I will use this until I find a burr grinder that meets all my requirements and isn't 300 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: toptime79

customer_reviews.title: An ok kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: It’s an OK device. Does it’s job but grinder coffee comes out of the metal cup and sits on the roof and sides of the plastic part.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Threw it in the trash
customer_reviews.text: Great product , first time ever grinding coffee. Then after about using 10 times the bowl became adhered to the mechanism and unable to remove the bowl. Grind everywhere. Turned me off to grinding coffee completely. Threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Holland

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and Messy
customer_reviews.text: This latest rendition of the gender is not as good as the old one. It holds less coffee and seems to throw it around more, making a mess when you take the top off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mcclellan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, poorly designed product all around. The first one I received never even worked. The second, even with the lid on shoots ground beans EVERYWHERE! Needs a rubber ring around the bottom of the lid. Returning and already bought a much better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Brady/ Staci Houska

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift and they can’t say enough how much the like it!
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Buy this before wasting money on expensive grinders.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, nice finish, easy to use, not bulky, gets the job done fast. Grinds the beans in no time and it’s a great price compared to other very expensive grinders that do the exact same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but material shaved from previous generation
customer_reviews.text: Shortened grind chamber allows more spill - previous gen is better
customer_reviews.author: Aladdin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Durable, Quiet and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Best grinder I have used. As a chef this is what I look for in a powerful and durable grinder for spices and coffee. Very quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase— not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT RECOMMEND. I saw Cuisinart and thought this was a smart purchase. I was wrong. Grinds everywhere, loud, and had it on for upwards of one minute and still didn’t have all the beans grinded. Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: Large 18-cup capacity, removable, dushwasher-safe bowl & one-touch operation Cusinart Coffee Grind! Good to buy this one. So easy to use and clean! Also nice looking!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hong

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of garbage. Broke 2 months in. We used about 5 days a week. After approximately 2 months, the motor ran out.
customer_reviews.author: J Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Didn't look at the size dimensions, but larger than my old Cuisinart grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K.

customer_reviews.title: quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: works great, never used a coffee grinder before but this is super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: iheartbeagles

customer_reviews.title: Grinds coffee beans well but makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and grinds coffee beans well but I lose a lot of product trying to get the ground coffee out of the grinder cup. Also, the ground coffee ends up stuck around the circular portion of the lid and outside the grinder cup and it's hard to get to it out without the coffee spilling all over the counter. I end up wasting a lot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one of these for years. The new ones are said to be just as good if not better. With the lid on tight and held down ground coffee goes all outside the bowl and 1/3 of the beans never grind. Grrrrr. For $34 it should be at least as good as my old one!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Thank you , Next
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It makes a mess no matter how many beans you grind. Then many times the grinder cup is hard to get off the base while it’s full of grinds. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Salata

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be more durable
customer_reviews.text: Well, it is a great little bean grinder, but mine broke after the 10th use. The cup has gotten stuck on the base and cannot be removed. Judging by other reviews, it seems that it simply doesn't last long. Certain parts are plastic when they should be metal, and they fail. (my opinion) Too bad, it is a great little machine.
customer_reviews.author: twaldo

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess everywhere
customer_reviews.text: It did a great job grinding but the coffee grounds were all over the place. As we'd grind, lid on, the grounds would just fall out of the cup and onto the outside of the machine. Take the lid off and coffee grounds are everywhere. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tina McConnaughey

customer_reviews.title: product is defective
customer_reviews.text: I have had this same cuisinart before and it worked fine until the grinder stopped so I reordered another one. It came and the actual label was upside down plus the container does not lock in place like before so it is loud and doesn't grind all the way. This should never have passed product inspection.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 👍
customer_reviews.text: Super cute , easy to clean and use. Grind the spices very good .
customer_reviews.author: Saad Tariq

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, kind of...
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the loud side and when grinding, the grounds get out of the stainless cup into the base. Grounds tend to pack into the cup under the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly&Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Simple Coffee Grinder Works Well
customer_reviews.text: My new coffee grinder replaced one exactly like it that lasted for 14 years. It needed replacing because one of the small plastic parts broke off. I was glad that exactly the same model was available. It's small enough to store well. It cleans up nicely. It's easy and uncomplicated to use.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder. On my second one, but first one lasted 8 years. A little surprised to see that nothing has changed on 8 years, but if it’s not broke, don’t fix it!
customer_reviews.author: mitch20

customer_reviews.title: Really efficient little grinder
customer_reviews.text: I was about to spend about 3 times the money on a big name coffee grinder when I found some reviews on this one. So I took the plunge, and am glad I did. This little grinder does the job perfectly, is easy to clean and stores in very little space. Once you've ground the beans, it's a snap to spoon the coffee out because of the wide opening. Plus it just looks pretty if you need to keep it out on your counter. Nice little product that seems to be of very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: EMC

customer_reviews.title: Slightly messier at grinding than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is less effective than the previous version I had in my kitchen for over 12 years. The grinder bowl is shorter and wider than the older version of this item. When I remove the lid after grinding coffee beans, ground coffee tends to spill onto the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am completely surprised that this product broke after only 5 uses. I have used this grinder for DECADES!! This is the only grinder I have ever used. Each grinder has lasted years. Not this one. Extremely disappointing. I won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: gingerleigh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grind properly and makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: This is the stupidest grinder there is. Overly complicated design, makes a big mess and does not even grind properly. Going right into the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Ragav Venkatesan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is very quiet and grinds the beans very well. The cup is easy to clean but some grounds usually manage to get in the bottom portion where the motor is. Also it’s hard to clean the top but I use a coffee brush and it’s dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: plawrenceheard

customer_reviews.title: a must buy for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: I love it ! I bought my mama one The one I have has been working for eight years now
customer_reviews.author: billy

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Grind Central Coffee Grinder
product_meta.description:
With the grind Central Coffee grinder, you can easily process up to 90g/3.2oz of beans at once, enough to make up to 18 Cups of fresh Coffee! With useful measurement markings inside the removal stainless steel bowl, you can grind The exact Quantity of beans you need for your next cup or pot of Coffee at the touch of a button. Features: Popular brushed stainless steel styling|On/Off control for simple operation|Built-in safety interlock prevents operation unless lid is securely closed|Bowl holds up to 90 grams of beans enough for up to 18 cups of coffee|Heavy-duty motor and stainless steel blades|Dishwasher-safe removable stainless steel bowl|Lid allows for extra coffee to be stored in grinding bowl|Cord storage|Storage lid|Instruction book|Limited 18-month warranty|BPA Free

AMAZON.COM
Operating at low heat to preserve flavor and aroma, this big, sleek coffee grinder can handle a whopping 90 grams of beans at once, enough for 18 cups, and it grinds spices at well. State of the art from its safety shutoff to its stainless-steel blade to its wraparound power cord, the grinder lends a modern look to any countertop. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: Brushed stainless steel styling with on/off control for simple operation
Built-in safety interlock prevents operation unless lid is securely closed
Bowl holds up to 90 grams of beans, enough for up to 18 cups of Coffee
Heavy-duty motor and stainless steel blades
Lid allows for extra Coffee to be stored in grinding bowl
